intro: Lonicera dumetorum, commonly known as honeysuckle, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caprifoliaceae. It is characterized by its fragrant, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange and red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or vine, with opposite, simple leaves that are usually heart-shaped. Its berries, which appear in late summer, are orange-red and contain toxic compounds. Lonicera dumetorum is native to temperate regions of Asia, Europe, and North America, and it thrives in a variety of soil types.
